attributes.action: remove the compulsory topic of "The Life and Crimes of Jack the Ripper" from the History section of the National Curriculum
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
The Government should remove the topic of “The Life and Crimes of Jack the Ripper” from the National Curriculum for History. This has been a COMPULSORY(!!) subject since Sept 2008 ( at the same time Winston Churchill was removed) . It’s inclusion is supposedly justified  by experts who claim  that looking at ‘mysteries’ in history  where children have to think  about what could have happened helps to develop  analytical processes. There are plenty of far less puerile examples of “what if” scenarios without having to teach and titillate young teenagers  about the mutilation of prostitutes . 

IF you wish to see examples of the fairly repellent teaching resources that are deemed appropriate for this aspect of your childs education simply google "National Curriculum Ripper" some of the material is billed as  “gruesome and disturbing Power Point presentation -not for the squeamish- ideal for average year 10-11 pupils.” These presentations include photos of the murdered womens faces and descriptions of the mutilations.
